question: What is the purpose of defining key performance indicators (KPIs) in a project and how do they align with business objectives?
contexts:
This step involves defining the key performance indicators (KPIs) for your project. 
                 These should be clear, measurable outcomes that align with your business objectives. 
                 KPIs will provide a quantifiable outcome.

What is the baseline performance? 
                 Define a baseline performance level, based on the current system or a considered good baseline. 
                 A baseline provides a point of comparison to gauge the AI system’s performance and improvements.

A complete solution architecture that details how the AI system fits into and enhances the current workflow. 
                 The solution architecture will serve as a blueprint for system implementation and integration.
answer: The purpose of defining key performance indicators (KPIs) in a project is to establish clear, measurable outcomes that align with the business objectives. KPIs provide a quantifiable outcome that can be used to track progress and measure success. By aligning KPIs with business objectives, the project team can ensure that they are working towards the same goals as the organization and that the project outcomes will contribute to the overall success of the business.
